website_summaries.verdict: A simple, quality, and surprisingly inexpensive gaming mouse pad solution that gets the job done to comfortably keep you in the game for longer.
pros: High thread count delivers excellent mouse accuracy
cons: An option with added wrist support would have been welcome

customer_reviews.title: Should not be called a mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I got a hard steel series pad so I could use my mouse on my couch. It worked great, until my cat discovered it. Now I can only use about 2 inches of it, luckily the surface works well with my steelseries mouse's hi dpi setting.
customer_reviews.author: 26oo

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse Pad
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is great. I previously was using just the standard QcK pad, but I'm now using my girlfriend's desk--which she spent many, many hours refinishing--for my computer so I wanted something to protect the wood from all of my peripherals and other junk. The XXL is perfect. It covers enough space for my mouse, keyboard, and headset with room for me to have my phone in front of me as well (see my photo). It's also a little bit thicker than the standard QcK, which I like. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gocek

customer_reviews.title: Get the classic QCK+
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to pad. I have tried almost every soft pad out there from Logitech, Razer and Steelseries including the limited and Heavy. The heavy is a close second but the thinner QCK+ is slightly slower with just a touch more control. This is simply a product of slightly more friction. Yes the thinner pad has more friction and heat. works well with light mouses. Currently using Cooler Master MM710 at 53 grams. Highly recomended
customer_reviews.author: fang

customer_reviews.title: Stitching causes it to not lay flat
customer_reviews.text: If you really like a desktop mat like this to lay flat, this is likely not the surface for you. I believe it is the stitching between the RGB and the pad causing this wave or wrinkle to show up. I attached a couple of photos for your enjoyment. Overall, I love the utility of the surface and the integration into the games. For things like forgetting my Mic is muted or indicating something in a game, it is amazing. For not laying flat, which is the most important feature, it gets a 1 of 5.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: you guys are ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: For the person(s) complaining about not getting this mouse pad to unroll flat, be smarter than the mouse pad, roll it up the opposite way it was rolled and stick it back in the box for a while, pull it out and it will lay flat, that easy, thank me later
customer_reviews.author: Christi M.

customer_reviews.title: The smell is absolutely horrid and the surface has changed.
customer_reviews.text: The smell was unbearable right out of the box. It didnt have the expected new rubber/fresh from the factory smell that a lot of mousepads tend to have. It smelled like gasoline and some other sort of toxic mixture which filled up my room, and transferred to my hands after touching it. The mousing surface is also different from the QCK+ and the QCK Heavy and is far too slick with not enough stopping power to it. I was willing to overlook the non-stitched edges to get what I thought would be a much larger and better qck+ but this is a huge disappointment. I will be returning it due to the smell alone.
customer_reviews.author: I just like music

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase that will keep you competitive for years to come
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse pad in 2015, and boy have I gotten my money's worth, as well as put some serious miles on this thing, (seriously, -miles-) and I can say without a doubt, this is the best mouse pad I have ever owned. It is even now barely showing any signs of age, and it still stays firmly planted to my desk. I primarily purchased this mouse pad during the height of my Counter-Strike: Global Offensive career, and it didn't let me down one bit. I've since 'downgraded' to more leisurely affairs such as Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn which requires just as much mouse movement as any other game, and it does the job flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Flamisch

customer_reviews.title: Buy this Mouse Pad - move on to other shopping
customer_reviews.text: SteelSeries QcK+ Review Excellent large format mouse pad. It is very thin and floppy and as such needs a solid surface. The material is a soft-ish foam, similar to croakies glasses holders. The bottom of the pad is a textured rubbery surface to prevent slippage. The size is perfect for never having to worry about the edge of the pad. All of my optical mouses perform flawlessly without any tracking issues (Logitech G5, G500, G600 and MX-mini). I find the price to be perfect. I buy a new one every other year or so just for cleanliness. They hold up well. It is just a bit thinner than the Xtrack Ripper XL pad, which I am also a fan of.
customer_reviews.author: Awan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Microsoft Sculpt Mobile Mouse, old product and not as shown in the pic
customer_reviews.text: I have absolutely no idea why, but my Sculpt Mobile Mouse, which works perfectly well on many other surfaces, completely fails when I try to use it with the QcK. It's not like the cursor stutters or jitters, it doesn't even make the slightest movement. Also, the product I got delivered wasn't what's in the picture - the picture shows the new QcK Small pad (which has the SteelSeries logo without the brand name), but I got the old QcK Mini pad (has the logo *with* the brand name). Very disappointed with both Amazon and SteelSeries.
customer_reviews.author: Dean A.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I was forced to purchase the un-stitched version of the QcK after waiting months for the trimmed version to come back in stock. It came covered in dust and dirt and was torn at the edges. After cleaning it off it works much better then the wood table top or a magazine, but I'm overall a little dissatisfied with it. On the more positive side, it's still one of the best deals for a large mouse pad (and it is large) and at the end of the day it does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: D T.

customer_reviews.title: Just big enough for gaming, not too big for general use- Bought two for my sons' - they use them for gaming and homework
customer_reviews.text: These are a high quality mouse pad for those wanting something of good quality to cross over between gaming and general use. They are thin, on purpose, and are big enough to use for gaming, but not so big that they get in the way for general use. They still leave ample space on the desktop, but are just big enough for when you want to use it for gaming. I know they are doing the job, since I put them on my sons' desk a couple of weeks ago, they haven't complained once!! ;-) Thanks for reading.
customer_reviews.author: Timbo Slims

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it for $60
customer_reviews.text: This is junk. The RGB strips on the edges lose their color on the far right ends and fade. I have the XL version. Maybe this isn't an issue on the smaller pads. My $20 RGB pad looks a lot better as far as the colors are concerned. It doesn't have USB support or any sort of software to manage it but I prefer a solid strip over their software control. The image is my $20 pad. It's slightly smaller than the XL but not by much.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great Mousepad
customer_reviews.text: Overall: I would highly recommend this mousepad. I would recommend the thick since it removes the need of a wrist rest for me since the wrist bone in contact with the desk is cushioned by the thickness. I have been using this for 3 years playing all types of FPS games using low sensitivity. 800 DPI 1 in-game for CS:GO and similar setting for all others to keep it consistent. I had an issue with the mouse cord snagging due to the thickness (even with a mouse bungee). Now I use the G305 from Logitech and it's working flawlessly for my need. I wash it with soapy water and let it air dry when needed.
customer_reviews.author: ayTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Disappointingly Poor Durability
customer_reviews.text: Despite the glowing reviews this regularly receives, its durability is poor at best in my experience. Replacing a six-year-old mouse pad I got from the Intel HQ gift-shop near San Jose (made of recyclable materials, nonetheless), this began peeling at the edges within two months of use -- something my extremely cheap, previous one never did. I don't know why this became a "best seller" on Amazon, but I assure you there is nothing special or impressive about this at all. While I can't yet suggest a better alternative, all I can say is: this ain't it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Smith

customer_reviews.title: My favorite mousepad so far.
customer_reviews.text: I own the g640, fury s, gigantus v2 and the glorious and the QCK heavy is my favorite of them all so far. It's just very easy to be consistent on. Speed is close to the Gigantus but a lot smoother. The durability after a month, so far no complaints whatsoever. The price is really good compared to the g640 with similar build quality aside from the non stitched edges. The edges show no signs of fraying so far though. I love the performance and the weave is very premium, you cannot go wrong with the heavy, promise.
customer_reviews.author: I23cl

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Behold! This is not just any ordinary mousepad. I don't just place my computer mouse on it. I can also leave my pen or pencil there too. Plenty of room for that, believe me! Sometimes, a stray Post-It Note or flash drive also find a home on its thick and sturdy exterior. Know that if you purchase this mousepad, it is so welcoming to any office supply you might neglect that it really deserves an award for being the halfway house to lost office supplies. Don't miss this opportunity to buy a such versatile product! Don't let your loose items embark on their journey without a pit stop on this mousepad!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Would 10/10 Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I'm at my desk well over 50% of my time these days between WFH and trying to decompress while playing video games. This mouse pad was well worth the investment. The thick styling is not for everyone, but I find it provides a little added comfort while also keep the edges flat against the desk. I've had absolutely 0 tracking issues with either my MX Master or G502 Lightspeed. This is my second SteelSeries mousepad (the first went into the office after years at home - still looks great) and I find it hard to believe I'll ever buy from anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Good tracking, comfortable, bad packaging causes edges to warp
customer_reviews.text: The material used in this mouse pad is great. It tracks well, the mouse moves easily, and it's comfortable if you rest your wrist on it. I just really wish they wouldn't pack these rolled up in a small box. The edges are warped from being rolled up and still won't sit flat after days of use. I had this issue with a pricier roccat hiro+ pad as well that is still warped after several months. Fortunately this one isn't quite as bad and has enough flat surface to be usable, but still annoying. Does it really save that much rolling these up as opposed to using a flat envelope? Is it worth aggravating the customer for a few cents?
customer_reviews.author: JR1

customer_reviews.title: Been using for years and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I originally started with the regular sized version of this mouse pad and loved it for years. About a year and a half ago I upgraded to the larger version. I wish I had this one all along. Being able to move your mouse around anywhere on the desk is very useful and offers a more comfortable experience. I have uploaded a picture of the large and regular version - both of which I recommend. My girlfriend uses the regular sized one and I use the large one. No complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: J & M

customer_reviews.title: Thin, fast, accurate, small retains packaging curve for a long time
customer_reviews.text: I bought the small size as I was looking for a quality mouse pad for my desk, not for gaming. I use a Logitech G502 gaming mouse on it as well, no issues, nice and fast, no accuracy / jumping issues. The one thing that is annoying me though is that even after leaving it squished under a book for a few days, and now trying to use it for two weeks, it still retains some of the tight curve from the packaging. Not sure if that's specific to the small size, which was really rolled tight, or if all of them are rolled that tight and have the same retention issue.
customer_reviews.author: Interwebz Admin

customer_reviews.title: Great mousepad
customer_reviews.text: I bought the version of this without the stitched edges first. I noticed some black lint rubbing off and I've had mouse pads peel before so I quickly ordered this instead. It's much better, the anti-fraying quality helps the mat last longer and keeps my desk clean. I already have a mouse pad for my main setup at home so I use this at work now. Given it's clean black design and the simple SteelSeries logo, it doesn't stand out. It doesn't scream "gamer" like RGB or more over-the-top logo would. That said, it works well with all of my gaming mice at home. I ordered the medium size and it suits my use.
customer_reviews.author: Moses Chen

customer_reviews.title: Really good quality!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the stitched edge medium size, and it has been great. I have been using it now for a few months and it still looks brand new. It took a few days to flatten out being shipped rolled up, but it wasn't a problem at all. My mouse moves really smoothly on it and keeps my desk from being worn down. The size is perfect for gaming and I wouldn't need anything bigger. If you are just casually browsing the internet, you good go with the smaller version. Overall, very good quality, and I highly recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: NWRobotics

customer_reviews.title: Very big, but I fixed that.
customer_reviews.text: My standing desk has a retractable keyboard drawer. I wanted to be able to use a mouse in the narrow space next to the keyboard without the "clunk, clunk" of plastic on wood. Measured and cut (scored with straightedge and Stanley knife, then finished with regular scissors) this pad narrower to custom-fit the drawer and very happy with the result. There is a tiny bit of fraying at the cut edge, but not noticeable to me unless I look for it. The extra piece can easily function as a separate, oversized mousepad.
customer_reviews.author: D. P.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice.
customer_reviews.text: Great mousepad! Nice large size, thin, good texture, very nice stitching on the edge, stays planted on a glass desk, pretty much perfect. I bought this in desperation , because I thought there was something wrong with my mouse. Bought another mouse, same tracking problem. Came to realize that my old mousepad did not play nice with my laser mouse, and the problem was the pad causing intermittent tracking errors, super frustrating especially when gaming... ! Switched to this pad, problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: isiton?

customer_reviews.title: QcK Heavy XXL, big and comfy!
customer_reviews.text: Long, wide and thick does the trick. Plenty of room to move everything around on. Fits keyboard, drawing tablet and mouse. I do a lot of design work and was getting tired of my mouse slipping off my smaller Steelseries mousepad so I went with this thick boi. No regrets. My desk is 48"L so it covers a lot of it. Lays flat right out of the box. Mouse glides smoothly and though I haven't played any games with it yet, I'm 100% sure it will be great (steelseries is simply the best). 5 stars all day.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer sandwich

customer_reviews.title: decent, but does not lay flat
customer_reviews.text: Another product that seems to get all kinds of rave reviews, that I cannot understand. It is a nice enough mouse pad, but nothing special. It is good quality from what I can tell. Surface is nice with just enough smooth/vs grip for the mouse to feel good using it. It is rather thin, though. So resting your hand on it is not that comfy. I also have had it unrolled for several days now and one edge is even under my keyboard. It still does not lay flat on either and and all down the mat I can see vertical marks from where it was rolled up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: Works without issues. I really like how simple it is, I don’t want a gaudy mouse pad with leopard print and a meme on it. This one allows me to avoid messing up my desk and the mouse reads it very well. A big bonus is that the material so far has stayed intact, meaning my mouse stays clean and free of little pieces of fabric. My desk would carry enough dust and random hairs that the bottom of my mouse would get dirty from time to time and start dragging a bit. I’ve been using these at home and office for several years without issues and no obvious wear and tear on either so far.
customer_reviews.author: Big_Pops

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with my laptop, on my lap desk. It's the perfect size for that. It doesn't slide around, is very smooth, and my logitech wireless mouse works great on it. I roll it up and store it in my tech bag, and it still lays flat after! I highly recommended iy. Great price, and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: AmyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: ... first got the mouse pad I thought it was great. Then I noticed that my mouse was periodically ...
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the mouse pad I thought it was great. Then I noticed that my mouse was periodically stuttering. In shooters, I'd start slowing looking left or right, then the mouse would just stop and stutter for a moment before continuing. I thought it was an operating system issue or an issue with my mouse, but this is only reproducible while I'm using this mousepad. I removed the mousepad and just used my desk and the problem has vanished. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, soft  with extra room
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Mouse pad for my son that play video game in xbox and we can not be more please with this one, is soft comfortable , the mouse move smoothly in it, stay in place, it give you a lot of space to move the mouse around, we have the keyboard, mouse and a part of the xbox one in the desk this mouse pad measure 36 x15 approx. the corners stay flat. This mouse pad is a replacement for the SteelSeries QcK mouse pad, same quality a little more thicker than the xxl, but great product too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeimy M

customer_reviews.title: A gigantic mousepad you can put your keyboard on to protect your desk.
customer_reviews.text: As stated in an earlier review, this is the perfect mousepad if you need a gigantic one--there is ample room for your keyboard and mouse, with inches to spare, so the pad can start at the edge of your desk, and extend for five inches or so from the top edge of your keyboard. It won't slip and the corners won't peel up, and it's easy to clean. This will protect your antique desktop if that's what you need, and as far as I can tell the rubberized backing will not stain or disintegrate. I was amused when I saw the pic of this mousepad, but it's exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Petorius

customer_reviews.title: Had it since 2015 and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mouse pad since 2015 and I have yet to encounter any major issues with it. It does like to slide around when I'm doing a lot of gaming, but other than that it is a durable pad that doesn't negatively impact my gaming in any way. I use my computer for well over 8 hours almost every day and the mouse pad has not shown a single sign of wear. I'm limited by my desk space, so I only have room for the mini mouse pad; however, once I get a larger desk I will certainly buy another SteelSeries QcK pad.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: With any quality, modern mouse laser technology has advanced so far that the surface you use it on really doesn't matter. Having said that this mat is very durable and offers great grip so your mouse won't glide anywhere on its own but you can still move it where you want it to go rapidly and without resistance slowing you down. It does everything you need a mat to do and it does it at a very low price. Buy this and never even think about a mat ever again. (If you game on the go I suggest buying 2 in case you lose one or it gets stolen. They are cheap and peace of mind is priceless)
customer_reviews.author: Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a soft, cloth style mouse pad. The grip holds well, the top has my mouse just gliding smoothly across it as it should, and the tracking is as perfect as it can be. I ordered the Large Thick, and I got exactly that. I'm thoroughly impressed. I'm use to using smaller pads, so this is an adjustment for me. It's so large, that I'm considering cutting it into 4 different pieces and giving them to friends. I may just have to order the XXL to get some padding for my new K70 Keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: AlaskanGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse pad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic mouse pad, works great and feels fantastic. Doesn't have the greatest durability so if you're transporting it a lot and folding it and throwing it in your backpack and also gaming heavily on it, it will fall apart quickly. If you just leave it on your desk it will last you a while. Low price point + good product so it's not a big deal to buy a couple a year however I do wish the durability and material quality was better so that the mouse pad doesn't start falling apart at the edges. It will unglue itself at the edge and the flaps will start coming up with heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Just sits there...
customer_reviews.text: I’m not really sure how much you can say about a mousepad. Pretty standard stuff here, it’s black and looks ok, nothing too fancy. Seems like a nice material. Stays where you put it. Mouse slides over it smoothly and seems to pick up all movements with the laser eye. It takes about a day for it to lay completely flat after you remove it from its box where it’s rolled up. I’d recommend this mouse pad. If this review was helpful click that button below...thanks!
customer_reviews.author: AverageDad

customer_reviews.title: Great pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty darn good pad. It really doesn't move about on its own (not like ALL my old pads, they would inch about during gaming sessions). Its nice and thin so its not bothering my wrists. The surface I guess has a nice glide to it, but its mostly in part to having decent mice feet as well. Overall, a very good buy and well deserving. And for those who complain it remains 'curled' ... it is for like, the first day. Really, some people are so impatient with results these days.
customer_reviews.author: IncredibleHat

customer_reviews.title: If at first you dont succeed,  try again!
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost I have to be honest. First one I purchased, zone 2 (bottom half) was busted and did not light up. This SECOND one I replaced it with works perfect. Material is great, lights are bright, love the feel of the mouse over it, and looks good on the desk. Just be warned you might have to send one back to get a working one.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and works great with my iMac and Logitech PRO Gaming Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Been using this now for over 6 months and have to say it looks great on my desk and also works great as a mousepad. Also the mac driver SteelSeries 3 engine loaded fine on MacOS Catalina and I never had a problem with it. Being a softer cloth material it does get dirty easily (my fault for eating while working) but it also cleans up easily. Looks much better than my scratched up desk surface it's covering up - I love the large size!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gadget

customer_reviews.title: I love this mousepad!
customer_reviews.text: This mousepad is fantastic, and the perfect size for me. It comfortably fits my Logitech G19 keyboard on it and leaves plenty of room for my mouse. I actually have a Logitech Powerplay mat under this pad to charge my mouse as well and it works wonderfully. I love that I can adjust the brightness on it as well. The color is nice and bright throughout and the stitching feels secure and well done. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley W.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Im using this for my Razer Viper and it makes my mouse very responsive. I like the fabric and the feel of it. I wanted to get the hard version but read some reviews and chose this one instead. I wish it was little bit thicker but still feels nice when gliding my mouse around in gameplay.
customer_reviews.author: Qi W.

customer_reviews.title: The legend gets prettier
customer_reviews.text: The Steel Series QcK mouse pads really need little introduction at this point. If you're a gamer, you've no doubt seen these pads. Great quality, solid materials, all around fantastic mouse pads. The Prism is essentially more of the same while being pretty. There is a very thin rgb strip that is stitched around the entire edge and is customizable with millions of colors. The colors are nice, not too harsh, and you can customize them in the Engine 3 software. The pad is absolutely worth it if you want to add a little more bling to your desk. My only regret is that I wish I would have bought the larger one.
customer_reviews.author: Remy

customer_reviews.title: I will never use a regular mouse pad again.
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade from a normal mouse pad. Gamers may want a larger on than this, but it's a definite upgrade from regular mouse pads. I tend to move the mouse off of the mouse pad and it's really frustrating. With this larger mouse pad I can navigate on the entire screen. The pad without sewn edges works fine for me. I like it so much that I purchased it for my home and office. At my old job we bought them for all of the media controlling computers (slides/movie presentation use). If I had a bigger desk I'd probably get the larger size, but for the price you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Himmy Jiggins

customer_reviews.title: 0 complaints about this mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Mouse pad does not move on the table / desk. Does not get dirty easily (unless you get sweaty or have oily wrists) Stitching does not tear apart over time Inexpensive Cons: None Unless you are picky with designs on your mouse pads, there really is no going wrong on this one. It will last you a long time if you clean it, and the stitches wont tear apart with a little washing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs:
customer_reviews.text: The pad is easy to roll up so that I can take it with me whenever I am traveling, while being large enough to give me room to work with my mouse effectively. I like the surface; it is nice and smooth, as a mouse pad should be. On the underside, there is nice rubber so that it is less likely to move around on you while working the mouse. Lastly, the construction seems to be good quality and should be durable for long product life.
customer_reviews.author: Jeebs

customer_reviews.title: feels nice, can be wrapped up and stored away quickly ...
customer_reviews.text: Although billed as gaming. I purchased this so my wife doesnt struggle with a mouse on our dining room table. For whatever reason the mouse doesnt track accuratly on black wood (maybe the ridges in the wood messes with the mouse's laser?). All i know is this thing is large, feels nice, can be wrapped up and stored away quickly and tracks VERY well. I guess thats the gaming aspect, but most importantly I dont hear her cursing at the notebook because she cant place a table accurately while creating lesson plans for her classes.
customer_reviews.author: PiyoPiyo

customer_reviews.title: Soft, just thick enough, and super smooth
customer_reviews.text: I don't play many FPS or fast paced games on PC but within the games I do play, I can feel how smooth and helpful this pad can be. I feel no resistance and the mouse just glides exactly where I push it. Out of the box it comes rolled up. This led to one edge being curled for a couple weeks since I just let it sit there in hopes in worked itself out, which it did. Im sure setting a heavy book on it would speed that time up.
customer_reviews.author: John Hess

customer_reviews.title: How great can a mouse pad be?
customer_reviews.text: The padding is good. Not too hard, not too soft. The mouse glides very easily with just the right amount of friction. You dont think this is a big deal until you try many different kinds. The feel is not irritating on my wrist. The surface layer and the pad is adhered very well. Usually they start to fall apart on the cheap ones but this one is still in tact after a year of heavy use. I sweat a lot... usually the sweat that absorbs into regular mouse pads end up making the rubber weak and it starts to break up into small peices after a while. No issues yet with this pad. No cons.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent material and size
customer_reviews.text: I really like these mats (XXL). I ordered a second one to conver more of my desk because they're so well made. They're a really good choice because they're comfortable and durable. The bottom is finished with a coating too that helps. Over time the mat gets dirty from skin and other oils, but it can be scrubbed using detergent and a rag to make it look new. I have been very happy with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Nublet

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost mousepad!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a larger than standard gaming mousepad. This one was the right price, so i pulled the trigger and have not been disappointed. The best thing I can say about it is that I haven't had to think about it for one second since I bought it. It doesn't move, have any weirdness to the edges or smell funny. Its large enough that i don't go over the edges when I am playing and dampens the sound of my angry mouse thuds when I die playing Overwatch.
customer_reviews.author: MadStan1

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have several different models from steelseries all varying in sizes based on where I use them. They’re simple looking, feel nice, don’t move about, and seem to stay both clean and intact relatively easily. Certainly an upgrade from any mousepad you’ll get from some corporate handout at your last seminar on the latest happenings in the world of Mac & Cheese. The Qck I use at work mostly because it’s just big enough for me to feel comfortable, without people gawking over it and asking a million questions (already hear enough about all of my peripherals I rotate at the office.) If you use a computer all day, do yourself a favor and pick up a nice mousepad.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my adult son
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my adult son, who is an avid gamer. He has used it for quite some time and has had NO complaint. If something was wring with it, he would have definitely let me know. He is extremely knowledgeable about computers and their accessories so, by his silence about this pad, I'm thinking that it is a great mouse pad. This is the pad he asked for along with a particular mouse that I recently reviewed on his behalf.
customer_reviews.author: Shortstack

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming surface
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had had experience with steelseries gaming mousepads before and needed a larger one to max out the size of my desk-space. I was using a smaller verision of this before and kept running off of it in certain situations in-game. This mousepad surface is excellent, not to soft not to slick, comfortable edges for your wrist. Unlike many other things, a really good mousepad doesn't have to break the bank. Very happy with this lineup, price/value. Works great with my logitech laser mouse.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeFan

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse pad some problems
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my mouse and i dont know if its just my mouse but my mouse which i got new sometimes doesnt work on this mousepad good for example sometimes the mouse doesnt sense that its on something and when i try to turn around in a shooting game it doesnt let me and trust me its not the mouse because my mouse which i bought new not used and my mouse is a high end gaming mouse that costs like 100 something or 200 something so im not sure why it does that but overall its a good mouse pad not wonderful not perfect but just a good mouse pad
customer_reviews.author: Jong

customer_reviews.title: Received a Fake
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son. The box says Steelseries but what was inside was not a Steelseries mouse pad. The mouse pad we received was smaller, did not have the Steelseries logo, was falling apart, and was previously used.
customer_reviews.author: chris79

customer_reviews.title: These are far thinner and feel less quality than the old pads
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Steel Series QcK gaming pads for a long time and I love them. I've had my last one since 2017 and it had some marks and fraying that couldn't be fixed so I bought a new one. The new stitched mats feel CONSIDERABLY thinner and less soft than the older ones. This is not to say I think this product bad or anything like that, Steel series is probably the best bang for you buck and I don't expect an issue with this mouse pad. Just be aware that if you have an older Steel Series and you get a new one, these feel a heck of a lot thinner.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Patrick

customer_reviews.title: big enough for two of my mice
customer_reviews.text: I use multi-screens and multi computers, which leads eventually to color coded keyboards and mice. One of my mouse pads was worn out and just bought this one because of the reviews and popularity. I really like it, I use it for two mice which makes it easier to shift back and forth, I also evict the working mice so the gaming mouse can have some free reign. My only issue is it was so big I had to reconfigure my coffee coaster.
customer_reviews.author: BShel

customer_reviews.title: Did you the mouse pad actually matters?
customer_reviews.text: I was using a cheap $12 mouse pad for over a year then when updating my setup was like okay what is the best gaming pad out there? This was used by most professional gamers so went for it and wow does it make a difference! I get a consistent glide and its not too sleek or too grippy. Great for FPS games where precision matters. Highly recommend if you are looking for every advantage you can get!
customer_reviews.author: Love to Shop

customer_reviews.title: Has not deteriorated after 1.5 years
customer_reviews.text: After owning this product for 1.5 years I feel I can now comment fairly on its quality. This mouse pad has maintained the same look and feel as when I first purchased. There is no fraying or any visible damage despite my propensity to play FPS games 8+ hours a week. Throughout my time with this product I have enjoyed having a larger area to use my mouse over when compared to the typical mouse pad size. With respect to FPS games, this increased size has allowed me to properly take advantage of lower sensitivity settings for greater accuracy (no need to lift and re-seat the mouse).
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: comfortable pad that fits on desk
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something comfortable for when I rest my wrists on the desk when using the keyboard and the mouse. I had ordered another one but it had stitching around the edge and irritated my wrists. I was using this while working for 8 hour shifts. That one was miserable. This one does not have stitching and is very comfortable. It is big enough to cover enough of my desk where the keyboard and mouse reside. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Chickey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! It's very long and you could use razor/lighter to shorten if needed
customer_reviews.text: LOL I didn't realize how large this was until I got it. I shortened my mousepad to fit my desk. I just used a razor to cut it and a waved a lighter quickly over the edges just for a second or two. I probably didn't need to Bic the edges because the material is really well made, but I did anyway. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: meowmeows

customer_reviews.title: Only really lights up properly where it plugs in
customer_reviews.text: I would think for the price of this thing it would have been a heck of a lot better. Where you plug it in, the colors are nice and bright. works as intended. As you get to the other end of the mousepad the colors are washed out, the brightness isnt even half of what it began with. I have no idea how they got the ad image to show it bright all around, but it isn't. Going to have to return.
customer_reviews.author: Jac

customer_reviews.title: Thicker is BETTER!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this awhile back and I love it. I had previously been using the "normal thickness" one and noticed it wearing out fairly easily. After this upgrade I can definitely tell the difference. The quality is overall very smooth and has no problem with the traction on my mouse. Only thing I would change would to have it slightly rounded along the edges for a smoother finish but besides that this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Adriana

customer_reviews.title: An unreasonably large mousepad for a perfectly reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: The images on the Amazon page do not do justice to how large this mousepad truly is. I recommend getting a tape measure or something and comparing the dimensions listed on the product page to the desk space where you'll be using it to get a better idea before deciding what size you want. The XXL is larger than a schooldesk and takes up more room than I expected but it won't be a problem except to avoid spilling coffee on it etc.
customer_reviews.author: Heath Zumstein

customer_reviews.title: Slips a little on laminated wood; surface is too rough
customer_reviews.text: My desk isn't slippery, it's just a regular laminate, but still somehow the pad moves around a little bit after about 4 hours of use in a day. That's kinda one of the main functions of a pad, hence the low score, because otherwise it's the same rubber as all the others. I palm my mouse and mostly use my wrist to move it around thanks to the higher sensitivity settings I use. I gave it an star because it's a good black color that doesn't reflect the mouse laser so everything is smooth. But the pad itself is not smooth, in fact it's rougher than it should be. No I am not using it upside-down.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Mousing Surface
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the SteelSeries QcK Gaming Surface - Small Cloth mousing surface along with the Razer Goliathus Speed (Small) Gaming Mouse Pad for use with my laptop. I found that the two products gave almost identical accuracy and tracking. The SteelSeries QcK Gaming Surface seemed smother and had less resistance. I liked it more than the Razer Goliathus.
customer_reviews.author: Tester

customer_reviews.title: Great desk mat
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up to replace a HyperX mat that was beginning to fray where the mouse swipes are and around the corners. Was debating between this and the Corsair mat and this was a few dollars cheaper so decided to give it a try. So far it feels and looks much better than the HyperX mat. Ordered the Corsair mat as well but hasn't come in yet. Overall a great desk mat for a tkl keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: leviathan42

customer_reviews.title: Works better than any other pad I have used.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the small pad because of limited desktop space. The pad seems to be of very good quality. It does not slip at all and the mouse is much more responsive than I have had on other pads. Not sure if that is because of the color or the texture of the surface but I just know it is better and I am very happy with the purchase. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: B Young

customer_reviews.title: Had to buy A Second!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the smaller pad for years and it’s been great. I forgot it at a friends place recently and decided to purchase the larger version. It was the best decision. The pad is smooth and consistent with enough real estate for some of the larger monitors. If you’re a gamer, this pad is excellent also. The gaming mouse I have glides easily and has the perfect resistence to maintain accuracy. Overall, it’s a great pad.
customer_reviews.author: Initial D

customer_reviews.title: Great mousepad!
customer_reviews.text: Mouse pad is great for gaming and general use. Plenty of room for swipes with high or low sens. Perfect for wrist gamers, while arm gamers might want a bigger size. Pros: good surface, razer lance head glides perfectly good for people with any sens good for people who put their arm further out than their keyboard while gaming perfect amount of real estate for multiple mice good for lefties and righties washable cons: any dirt or crumbs will stick to it, but that can be fixed by just shaking it. Great mouse pad overall, would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Hasan Zahra

customer_reviews.title: mouse pad doesn't work with hp mouse
customer_reviews.text: i just got a new pc595-p0074 the mouse and keyboard are wireless. i purchased this pad because it was rated very high. it barely work's with the mouse i have. if i move the mouse it doesn't move or moves erratically. i used the top of a box and the mouse works perfectly. i don't know why but it is useless to me. maybe for a different style mouse it is great but not the hp wireless i have.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Brunson

customer_reviews.title: Can't ask for much more!
customer_reviews.text: Great little pad, Steel Series has been known for awesome peripherals and accessories since I was a teenager even. Slick enough for low accurate dpi settings, just enough friction for a high dpi setting. Great overall product. I didn't want one of those huge mat style pads, but wanted something slightly larger and better quality than your standar office depot mouse pad. This is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: reu

customer_reviews.title: Pad is nice
customer_reviews.text: Greetings ... Reviewer, My first impression when I opened the package was how thin the mouse pad was. Don't expect the thin rubber mate to support the weight of your hand-wrist on the mouse. Secondly its 10x10 inch foot print on my limited space next to the keyboard. I assume the thin rubber backing and black nylon fabric is intended to be custom cut to the size of your mouse area, good design. I hope you have many years of PC-mousing. SacMac
customer_reviews.author: Fred MacRae

customer_reviews.title: The best cut to size!
customer_reviews.text: I have a desk where the keyboard and mouse slide out from underneath and I cut this to size using scissors so it would fit. I took a chance by doing so because I thought if I did this the ends would eventually fray but because of the way this pad is built, since it doesn't use end stitches to hold it together it is holding up wonderfully. Don't try this with other mousepads, they won't hold up. If you need one to cut to size then this is the only way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew W.

customer_reviews.title: All around good hard mousepaxld
customer_reviews.text: I got this to try it up against the Logitech g440 hard mousepad after that one eventually wore after a long life. I am all about hard mousepads for my moba gaming. I have to say that it is probably as good as the g440. The only disadvantage that I can tell is that the size of a bit more awkward compared to the other one. but besides that this one is cheaper and probably about the same so it's honestly up to preference.
customer_reviews.author: Royadin

customer_reviews.title: Best mousepad I've owned yet.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this mat. Durable as anything, massive enough to cover every place i needed it to be, and lets my mouse glide smoothly without a hitch. As an aside, it does not resist heat well (it should not be *expected* to, but between bowls of hot soup, or cups of hot coffee, I essentially eat, sleep, work, and play at my desk), and eventually it warped from my abuse of it... but it took a LOT of abuse before it started warping. ...so I turned it around and am finally abusing the other side of the mat. I will definitely be buying this again once I wear this one out completely.
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible chemical smell making me nauseous enought to throw up
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviewers have stated, this has a horrible smell that clearly feels like you are inhaling some toxic chemicals. It even leaves your hands smelling the same. Forget the comfort or how good it functions as a mouse pad, I wonder if this has chemicals that are hazardous to health!!!! I cannot believe this product has 94% 4.5 rating.
customer_reviews.author: Deepak

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse pad.
customer_reviews.text: 1. Build quality: The top layer is a very smooth fabric, seems to be neoprene - which is notoriously invincible. The middle layer is made of soft foam, and the bottom later has a grippy rubber finish to keep it from sliding around. 2. Looks: Simple, one logo in the corner, and blends in well with any desk. It looks cool, I like it. 3. Functionality: Material is perfect for all uses. Some mice pads are made of soft plastic or rough plastic for certain speeds. I found this material to work for all gaming and productivity needs. 5 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hinkston

customer_reviews.title: thicc and smooth
customer_reviews.text: The mousepad is thick with a soft rubber base, so it's comfortable and the edge doesn't irritate your arm. And everything glides smoothly on this mousepad, mice with bad mouse feet still glide smooth on this bad, everything does. It feels nice and soft on the arms, just a really comfortable mousepad to play on and that's what makes it so nice.
customer_reviews.author: Weed Dinosaur IV

customer_reviews.title: Must cheaper than expected
customer_reviews.text: While I'll admit it was my fault accidentally selecting this vs the one with the stitched edge, this product falls short. Even after about 2 months of use, it still has a bend in it left over from being rolled up in its packaging that has it floating over the desk surface unless my mouse is laying directly on top of it. Further, the edge is already fraying, and even on a premium desk surface it slides around more than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Yup, it's a mouse pad.
customer_reviews.text: It's a mouse pad, what can I say? Not sure how this one would differ from a $10 pad but it does it's job and so I can't ding its score because of my own ignorance. Heck, I was quite happily playing on a wooden surface with my old mouse and only purchased this pad due to my new mouse using a different kind of laser and I wanted to make sure I was going to have a working setup. Maye someone with more experience or is more of a connesouer (sic) could tell you why you should put out the extra money for this but I can't.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Leaf

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse pad I've used
customer_reviews.text: Using it for video and photo editing and it works great. I purchased the medium size and was surprised when it arrived rolled up in a box and not flat. The base and surface materials are not as thick as a standard office supply store mouse pad, and not the same material. But it unrolled perfectly flat and worked so well. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: ES-10004

customer_reviews.title: This can do anything other mouse pads can do, but better!
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid square black mouse pad. It looks and feels like a mouse pad. Provides a nice surface that my mouse can live on and get daily exercise on as well. It doesn't judge or discriminate against the color, brand or size of my mouse. This is a quality mouse pad that is holding up well, its slightly larger than I was expecting but not overly large. Works as expected and looks great. Other than that, it is a mousepad.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Was a real nice upgrade for me. All these mice these days have these 90 billion DPI sensors so using a mouse on top of my wood grain desk was a spastic nightmare. Great size for my work space, and I was surprised with how thin it was. Not flimsy, not cheap, just low profile I guess you could call it. Arrives pitch black but does grey out with a few weeks use (just throw it in the wash). Edges are beginning to warp a bit but nothing is starting to fray yet. Solid quality for the price and easy to replace if ever needed.
customer_reviews.author: Matt L.

customer_reviews.title: does wonderful job for the price
customer_reviews.text: this is one of the positive with highest number of reviews on amazon, the quality seems excellent for the price, the rubber bottom layer sticks nice to my table and doesn't move, the size is perfect, a little larger than a letter size paper, the fabric is fine and so makes it easier for the mouse to move on it, I don't think I could get anything better than this for the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This mouse pad works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very pleased with this mouse pad. I mainly use it for video editing and surfing the web and to my pleasure, I am not disappointed. I can confirm this pad can be used for hours on end (3-5 hours for my usage) and your hand, and wrist will not become fatigued or hurt. Also, this mouse pad is very easy to clean, as I mainly use just water to wipe away any residue. Overall, a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: BJ1517

customer_reviews.title: Nice and flat
customer_reviews.text: I have a different steelseries mousepad, one that isn't stitched around the edge. I have to say, this one is way better. It comes rolled up but laid flat immediately after taking it out of the package. The other one took some time to get mostly flat, I use that one at work. The feel is great and my Logitech G502 glides nicely on the surface. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Rgb desk mats are not all they are cracked up to be.
customer_reviews.text: So as far as the lighting Is concerned the colors brightness tapers off pretty quickly. If you game for long periods of time and or even a few hours you will start to notice how the fishing line that holds the diffuser really runs your forearm raw. I am constantly running out of mouse space on it. However other than that it's awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: It's a mouse pad and it does its job. It feels different from my previous mousepad, but the Razer DeathAdder mouse I have responds really well on it. The small size is perfect for me and takes up enough space without making my desk look crowded. Good cheap mouse pad that I look forward to buying in the future when this one has worn out.
customer_reviews.author: dezymondTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Pretty smooth
customer_reviews.text: I used to not use any pads, it seems like the tech improved so now these steelseries ones are so worth it. The mouse just moves a bit easier, you are a bit more precise and it's nice and comfy for you hand. The only negative I can think of is that it gets dirty and starts looking whiter in certain spots - at least it's easy to clean it with just water.
customer_reviews.author: sdanzzz

customer_reviews.title: Great for FPS
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this mouse pad by two different people. I was a little unsure at first as i had never owned a mouse pad this large before but as soon as i received it, i feel in love. The quality is very high; the material feels really nice. I recently started playing CS:GO and the size is so much better for this. It's definitely something you should buy if you play or are planing to play any fps game that requires accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: hope

customer_reviews.title: GREAT! Perfect price, perfect mouse pad.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse pad is a GREAT size and of wonderful quality. It also just happens to be at a great price. I ordered this at the same time as I ordered my SteelSeries Arctis 7 gaming headset (another amazing product), and I was definitely not disappointed. I would also like to mention that this companies packaging is VERY nice. The attention to detail is great, even when it comes to packaging a mosue pag. That is the sign of an excellent brand who really pays attention to the details when it comes to their products.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Painter

customer_reviews.title: Wow.. and it's just a mouse pad
customer_reviews.text: How many mouse pads have you had? Pretty ones. Funny ones. Free gifts. Quick buys. And what does it matter. It's just a mouse pad. And then you spend a little bit more on this one. Plain black. Nothing fancy or funny. Just a mouse pad. But them you realise that it matters. Using a mouse everyday, you suddenly notice that it never stutters anymore. The flow is always as intended. You forget you use it until you don't. Its called the hygienic factor. In short. Spend some extra on items you use on a daily basis. This little investment simply pays back in reduced nuisance already.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dodo

customer_reviews.title: mouse surfaces pealed away from rubber mat a week after I got it.
customer_reviews.text: works great as far as mouse goes, but the cover isn't durable. love the materials and how it fits my space and how my device glides on it for game play, it is a perfect size - but, I have already had to glue the edges back on to the pad twice since purchasing in Dec 2018. All said, I would probably buy and glue edges again because i like it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: C. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Mouse pad the size of the state of Kentucky
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a mouse pad to go under my keyboard and mouse. This did not disappoint. I’m also able to park my car on it at the same time and still have space for yoga. It’s the size of the state of Kentucky. All joking aside, I love this pad. It’s cushiony, big, and thick enough to use on a variable surface like gravel or the junk in the side pocket of my swivel desk.
customer_reviews.author: Bardlady

customer_reviews.title: Junk, they wrinkle and permanently fold if you look at them sideways.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much total junk. The surface of the pad works well for its purpose (hence 2 stars). However, the pad wrinkles very badly, and the corners all quickly became folded up and would not flatten out. I had two of these, different sizes, and had the same problem with both. The problems started within 2 weeks on one, within a month on the other. I was hoping for decent quality given the brand name, but the low price should have clued me in. Don't waste your money on these pads, they are trash.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: No sudden movements
customer_reviews.text: Usually when I game the mouse tends to shift slowly and for my fps peoples out there you know that even the slightest movement counts. So with this mouse pad there is no more sudden movements when gaming.
customer_reviews.author: DeAndre

customer_reviews.title: XXL >> XL
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Thick, wide, cloth. Con: shows leftover skin cells easily. (Not a big deal. You can clean it) The material feels slightly better than my Godspeed desk mat at work. Not stitched which is not a big deal so far. If you have space and don't have a wide mouse pad yet, you want one. Having a pad under your keyboard is great. Coming from a XL (large square) pad I won't be going back. There are alternatives that glide more and have custom print from some mechanical keyboard sites. In my opinion, the smoother surfaces don't feel as natural, however.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: It's not black, and seems pretty weird...
customer_reviews.text: It's not black, and seems pretty weird... Feel like already used...
customer_reviews.author: Jyun-Siang, Ynag

customer_reviews.title: I cut it down to fit my keyboard tray
customer_reviews.text: I have about a 27 x 11 inch keyboard/mouse tray. Needed something a little softer to rest my wrists on. I cut this down to size and it's great. The mouse works almost as effortlessly as it did without any mouse pad. I'm not a gamer, but this is just what I needed for working long hours on the computer. It did have a 'new rubber' smell for about 15 - 20 minutes after I took it out of the box. I don't think there was any smell by the end of the day. And I have some left over from what I cut off; I'm sure it'll come in handy for something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: SteelSeries QcK Gaming Surface - Medium Cloth - Best Selling Mouse Pad of All Time - Optimized For Gaming Sensors - Maximum Control, Black
product_meta.description: Style:Classic| Size:Medium| Color:BlackQck mousepads are the top choice of esports pros. The legendary micro woven cloth has made the Qck line the world’s bestselling gaming surface. Tested by the top mouse sensor manufacturer, the high thread count and smooth surface optimizes mouse-tracking accuracy for both optical and laser sensors. Durable and washable, the Qck is easy to clean and keep in competitive condition.
feature_bullets: The top choice of esports pros for nearly 20 years
Exclusive QcK micro woven cloth optimized for low and high DPI tracking movements
Non slip rubber base eliminates unwanted movement
Recommended for most users with average desk space and mid to low DPI settings
320 millimeter x 270 millimeter x 2 millimeter / 12.6 inch x 10.8 inch

SteelSeries cannot guarantee the quality or authenticity of products sold by non-authorized resellers on Amazon, and they are not eligible for warranty. Authorized retailers: Amazon.com, Adorama Inc, Encore Technology, Spacebound
